meanings.definition: To hijack an aircraft in flight.
meanings.sent1: The criminals attempted to skyjack the plane and take control of it mid-air.
meanings.sent2: The terrorists threatened to skyjack the airplane if their demands were not met.
meanings.sent3: The movie plot involved a group of birds trying to skyjack a helicopter for a joyride.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to skyjack the plane, tossing it around like a toy in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The daring pilot managed to skyjack the aircraft back from the hijackers with a clever maneuver.

meanings.definition: A person who hijacks an aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The skyjack was swiftly apprehended by the authorities before any harm was done.
meanings.sent2: The airport security was on high alert for any potential skyjack attempting to board a flight.
meanings.sent3: The children at the school play pretended to be skyjacks, taking turns 'stealing' the imaginary plane.
meanings.sent4: The notorious skyjack was known for his daring escapes and ability to evade capture.
meanings.sent5: The news report featured an interview with a former skyjack who had turned his life around after serving time in prison.
